content.description:
Directions: Read the following selection carefully for comprehension. The selection is followed by a number of related questions and incomplete statements. Select the best answer or completion.

Vergil describes the fate of Misenus.

Atque illi Misenum in litore sicco,

ut venere, vident indigna morte peremptum,

Misenum Aeoliden, quo non praestantior alter

aere ciere viros Martemque accendere cantu.

(5) Hectoris hic magni fuerat comes, Hectora circum

et lituo pugnas insignis obibat et hasta.

Postquam illum vita victor spoliavit Achilles,

Dardanio Aeneae sese fortissimus heros

addiderat socium, non inferiora secutus.

(10) Sed tum, forte cava dum personat aequora concha,

demens, et cantu vocat in certamina divos,

aemulus exceptum Triton, si credere dignum est,

inter saxa virum spumosa immerserat unda.
content.question: The words forte . . . concha (line 10) are translated

choices.label: while by chance he makes the sea echo with a hollow conch
although he bravely makes a hollow conch echo the sea
while by chance the sea echoes with a hollow conch
when the empty seas strongly echo with the conch

content.answer: while by chance he makes the sea echo with a hollow conch

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
